intro: Coleosanthus fendleri, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, gray-green leaves that store water, a key adaptation to its harsh environment. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access groundwater in dry conditions. Coleosanthus fendleri is an important part of desert ecosystems, providing food and habitat for various desert organisms.
